result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon A. Goodell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No contact w/children under 18 years of age unless previously approved by agent.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties rec/rev PSI and are ready to proceed today.  State submits VIS's to the Court and he reviews them as does the DE.  State states recommendations.  Atty Masana agrees and makes statement on the DE's behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE of voting rights, appeal rights and felony firearms warnings.

Ct 1: 

Probation 10 years in each case concurrent to each other
Conditions of probation:
Costs/surcharges of $518 x 2 to be paid per agent
DNA samples to be provided
Sex offender registration
Maintain/obtain full-time employment and/or education per agent
Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances
Psychological evaluations and any recommendations per agent
Sex offender assessment/treatment and any recommendations per agent
No contact w/children under 18 years of age unless previously approved by agent
Any other conditions per agent
DE to report to P&P by 3:30 pm today 

348 days credit to be applied only if revoked from probation
Sentencing hearing at 07-13-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Masana gives status of pending motion.  Switching of the pleas would be appropriate and all parties are in agreement.  PSI would work for either case due to both cases are similar in fact.  State does not object to switching the pleas.  Court vacates order for dismissal on 14CF335.  Matter reopened.  Plea to Count 1.  Count 2 to be dismissed/read in.  PSI and free to argue.  State will not be recommending prison.  Proceed to sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Motion hearing at 07-09-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Masana states all matters are resolved and states agreement.  PSI to be requested w/parties free to argue at sentencing but the State agrees to not recommend a prison sentence.  State is in agreement.  Atty Masana enters NC pleas to Ct 1 in 14CF274 and Ct 1 in 14CF317.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  State explains to court that not all victims had notice as two of the cases were not on her calendar for today.  Recess for State to see if victim is available.  Back on the record the State notes they were unable to get ahold of the victim in 14CF274.  They will email the victim and notice her of the SEH so the DE can get started on the PSI.  Court will proceed today.  PSI is ordered.  To be completed not later than 4/30/2015.

14CF274
Ct 1:  NC
Cts 2 and 3:  Dismissed/read-in

Ct 1:  NC

14CM561 and 14CF335 are both dismissed/read-in

Jury trial on April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Atty Masana acknowledges rec. information/waives reading/stands mute to both counts.  Court advises DE of charges/maximum penalties.  Court enters Not Guilty pleas - Set for Trial.  Bond continued in 14CF335.  14CF317 and 14CM561 are to be set for trial also.  Bonds continued in all matters.

Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in custody.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Atty Masana notes waiver of prelim today in 14CF335.  DE agrees to prelim waiver in 14CF335.  Court questions DE on waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.

Return date on November 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Brandon A. Goodell appeared by video means with Attorney Steinman. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant currently represented by public defender, Peter Masana.  Defendant likely will qualify again.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Large criminal history of same type of offenses.  Gives new address.  Time limits waived. $2000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with M. (3/16/199) and no contact with females under age 18 years.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
